articles.headline: With Output Stumbling, Fed Takes a Modest Step
articles.snippet: The Federal Reserve increased its efforts to revive economic growth by extending its existing asset-purchase program through the end of the year.
articles.abstract: The Federal Reserve increased its efforts to revive economic growth by extending its existing asset-purchase program through the end of the year.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — In a pattern that has become familiar, the Federal Reserve said on Wednesday that the economy was growing more slowly than it had forecast, in part because its efforts to hasten recovery had proved insufficient.

articles.headline: For Spain, Accusations of Lagging on Reforms
articles.snippet: Financial markets eager for information on how Spain will fix its shaky banking system said the government needed to move more quickly on reforms.
articles.abstract: Financial markets eager for information on how Spain will fix its shaky banking system said the government needed to move more quickly on reforms.
articles.lead_paragraph: MADRID — Spain plans to release on Thursday two independent reports on the condition of the country’s banks, which the government has said it is awaiting to help determine how much of its bailout offer of 100 billion euros it actually needs.

articles.headline: NBC Prepares to Replace Ann Curry on ‘Today’
articles.snippet: NBC executives are said to be making a plan to replace Ann Curry only a year after she became the co-host of the iconic morning show.
articles.abstract: NBC executives are said to be making a plan to replace Ann Curry only a year after she became the co-host of the iconic morning show.
articles.lead_paragraph: NBC executives are making a plan to replace Ann Curry on the “Today” show, only a year after she became the co-host of the newly vulnerable morning television franchise.

articles.headline: Wary of Plastic, and Waste, Some Consumers Turn to Glass
articles.snippet: Consumers worried about potentially harmful chemicals contaminating their food and beverages are driving the rising popularity of reusable glass containers.
articles.abstract: Consumers worried about potentially harmful chemicals contaminating their food and beverages are driving the rising popularity of reusable glass containers.
articles.lead_paragraph: Glass water bottles, so yesterday. Plastic, so convenient; metal, so hip.

articles.headline: Relief in Every Window, but Global Worry Too
articles.snippet: Gases that seriously damage the ozone layer are mostly out of use in air-conditioning, but replacements have become significant contributors to global warming.
articles.abstract: Gases that seriously damage the ozone layer are mostly out of use in air-conditioning, but replacements have become significant contributors to global warming.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the ramshackle apartment blocks and sooty concrete homes that line the dusty roads of urban India, there is a new status symbol on proud display. An air-conditioner has become a sign of middle-class status in developing nations, a must-have dowry item.
articles.byline: By Elisabeth Rosenthal and Andrew W. Lehren

articles.headline: Car Survey Shows Fewer Complaints but More With Personal Electronics
articles.snippet: The latest automotive quality survey released on Wednesday by the research firm J. D. Power & Associates showed that consumers were reporting fewer overall problems with new vehicles.
articles.abstract: The latest automotive quality survey released on Wednesday by the research firm J. D. Power & Associates showed that consumers were reporting fewer overall problems with new vehicles.
articles.lead_paragraph: DETROIT — Carmakers are doing a better job than ever eliminating nagging problems like wind noise, paint chips and balky engines.

articles.headline: Bosses Rein In Banker Who Golfs With Obama
articles.snippet: A move to muzzle a fund-raising banker may be seen as another setback for the president on Wall Street, where he is raising far less than he did in 2008.
articles.abstract: A move to muzzle a fund-raising banker may be seen as another setback for the president on Wall Street, where he is raising far less than he did in 2008.
articles.lead_paragraph: One of the biggest banks in the world wants the president’s favorite banker muzzled.

articles.headline: C.I.A. Said to Aid in Steering Arms to Syrian Opposition
articles.snippet: A small number of American officers are operating secretly in southern Turkey, helping decide which Syrian rebel fighters across the border will receive arms.
articles.abstract: A small number of American officers are operating secretly in southern Turkey, helping decide which Syrian rebel fighters across the border will receive arms.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A small number of C.I.A. officers are operating secretly in southern Turkey, helping allies decide which Syrian opposition fighters across the border will receive arms to fight the Syrian government, according to American officials and Arab intelligence officers.
